Title: Coreutils: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in Coreutils could lead to the execution of
    arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: The GNU Core Utilities are the basic file, shell and text manipulation utilities of the GNU operating system.

Description.Text: A memory corruption flaw in GNU Coreutilsâ€™ parse_datetime function was reported. Applications using parse_datetime(), such as touch or date, may accepted untrusted input.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Coreutils users should upgrade to the latest version:
